page.title: 13Lower Annandale Dialect
page.content: The local speech is based on the Lower Annandale dialect. my = me / yow = you,ewe / Thee and Thou are still used. Some words and phrases still used. COWP = upend:FOREBY = as well: FORENOON = morning:THE MORN'S MORN = tomorrow morning: HOW MUCH DID YOU TAKE? and WHAT DID YOU LIFT? mean How much did you make? Accent on 'ed' is common. HanKED or slipPED A' tae the tay side = all to one side Come abreed = Come apart Gommerel = Idiot: Wally dug = China dog : Tattie = potato 'IA' at the end if a word often becomes 'IE'. Petunia = petunie : Dahlia = Dahlie The Lower Annandale dialect is not spoken by many people. They use a sort of patoise among themselves.
